definition: surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: This is the hour of an ablution heart.
sentences.chinese: 這是一個洗禮心靈的時刻。

sentences.english: In the New Testament, people were baptized as soon as they believed.
sentences.chinese: 在新約聖經中，人信主後便立刻接受洗禮。

sentences.english: On one occasion, I was given the task of baptizing an aborted child that did not make it through labor.
sentences.chinese: 有一次，我的任務是孩子流產了洗禮，不靠勞教人員。

sentences.english: The priest always christens his own child first.
sentences.chinese: 牧師總是先爲自己的孩子施洗禮。

sentences.english: And the positive result of the work in Kingston was evidenced in the many baptisms.
sentences.chinese: 在金斯敦工作的有效成果體現在多次的洗禮中。

sentences.english: Baptism is a water purification ritual practiced by all Christians.
sentences.chinese: 洗禮是所有基督教徒都要經歷的浸水淨身儀式。

sentences.english: February 14 is Chinese New Year and it is also Saint Valentine's Day. We will have a baptism service on that day.
sentences.chinese: 二月十四日中國新年又是聖瓦倫丁日，我們有洗禮。

sentences.english: So the moon has been informally christened.
sentences.chinese: 所以月亮已經被非正式的被洗禮了。

sentences.english: Be you really going to christen him, Tess?
sentences.chinese: 你真的要給他行洗禮嗎，苔絲？

sentences.english: This chapel has no baptismal font.
No matter how hard you try, you can't baptize cats.
sentences.chinese: 無論你怎麼嘗試，你都無法爲貓施洗禮。
耶穌是由約翰給他施洗禮的。

sentences.english: Father Willenborg himself performed the baptism.
sentences.chinese: 韋倫伯格神父親自爲孩子洗禮。

sentences.english: And so Peter says, "…baptism that now saves you also… It saves you by the resurrection of Jesus Christ."
sentences.chinese: 他說神采用洗禮的水讓我們獲得耶穌寶血的能力。

sentences.english: Wilde was baptised into the Catholic Church shortly before he died.
sentences.chinese: 王爾德在過世前受了天主教洗禮。

definition: to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal
to settle/to precipitate (solid sediment out of a solution)
to know from experience/to learn through experience/to realize/understanding/experience
